VerySimple.js is a light and simplistic JavaScript framework inspired by Angular and based on usage of html attributes.

VerySimple.js uses concept of component - an individual module represented by template (html file) and corresponding typescript/javascript class. Component could be nested and can interact with other components.
VerySimple.js IS NOT an SPA framework, thought could be used for building pseudo SPA applications without preserving browser's history.

1. Include vs.js or vs.min.js into your page
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<script src="http://verysimplejs.gearhostpreview.com/vs.min.js"></script>
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>

2. Define html template for the component
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<script src="http://verysimplejs.gearhostpreview.com/vs.min.js"></script>
</head>
<body>
<div vs-component="World" vs-src="world.js">
<span vs-model="greeting"></span>
<input type="button" vs-event-click="onGreeting()" value="Greet" />
</div>
</body>
</html>

3. Define the javascript code for the component and save it as the source for the template (world.js in this case)
class World {
constructor() {
this.greeting = "";
}
onGreeting(){
this.greeting = "Hello, World";
}
}
